===Etymology===
{{zh-compound|傀|儡|({{l|zh|塊}}) chunk, lump|({{l|zh|壘}}) to pile up, to accumulate}} Semantically, "statues made of soil and timber" (''{{w|Liezi}}'') > "puppet" > "(figurative) puppet" (''{{w|Qing Dynasty}}''); also "sulks, pent-up sorrow" (''{{w|Qing Dynasty}}'').

|mn=ka-lé

}}

{{zh-noun}}

# (''kuǐlěi'')
## [[puppet]]
## {{lb|zh|figurative}} [[puppet]], someone who is [[manipulate]]d by another
# (''guīlěi'')
## [[sulks]], [[pent-up]] [[sorrow]]

==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=くぐつ}}
Perhaps cognate with {{m|ja|裹|tr=kugutsu||hand bag}}. Wandering artisans would put their puppets in hand bags while traveling.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|acc=a|acc2=h|くぐつ|y=i}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くぐつ}}

# a [[puppet]]
#* {{RQ:Shin'yaku Kegonkyō Ongi Shiki|39-40}}
#*: 機関 木人 '''久々都'''
# a [[female]] [[artisan]] who wandered from place to place, [[entertain]]ing and [[perform]]ing with a puppet.
# a [[prostitute]].

{{ja-kanjitab|かい|yomi=o|らい}}

# A [[puppet]]
# A [[person]] who is [[used]] to [[use]] or [[control]]led as pleased like a puppet by a '[[puppetmaster]]'.
